title: It's absurd that RIot has allowed this to happen for so long. Rengar suffers while Twitch is around.
body:
Honestly I don't know why this has been a thing for almost a year now, it's absolutely absurd and is just a massive "screw you" towards us Rengar mains. I shall explain exactly what I am talking about, but I am quite sure you might already have an idea of what I have on my mind.

Since the assassin update back in 2016 Riot implemented 2 different kinds of stealth. Invisibility and camouflage. Camouflage was given to both Rengar and Twitch, and is basically just pre-assassin rework Evenlynn stealth. The most absurd thing though is that since the reworks Rengar has been almost destroyed through nerfs, and the reason being that he was still too strong when coming from stealth or the fact his early game was too strong.
On the other hand Twitch has been left almost completely untouched since then, while still being able to perform oneshots on people (or 5 for that matter). The only thing is that Twitch can do it in a much safer and reliable way, oneshotting entire teams without ever putting himself in danger.

To compare I've gone into practice tool to quickly get a few photos of both's range on their camouflage mechanic.

Twitch{{champion:29}} 

Detection range: approx 500 units
https://i.gyazo.com/c141fb0d87918231469b324aad4a84fa.jpg

Attack range with ult: 850 units
https://i.gyazo.com/748e316d6f3eb4f3eedff4a9009a7a87.jpg



Rengar{{champion:107}} 

Detection range and attack range: 725
https://i.gyazo.com/b977af69f73bf1052270eb45990fdf34.png





So in short Twitch has a far lower detection range and he can attack from this position with the longest auto attack range in the game. Just to make it even more clear, I'll compare them again in terms of all their strengths.

{{champion:29}} (Ambush):

* Has 500 detection range which is shorter than his normal auto attack range
* Activates after 1 second
* Gains 10% movement speed increased to 30% if someone is near him that can't see him
* Up to 50% attack speed
* Duration is 10 seconds and can be increased to 14 seconds
* 16 seconds cooldown
* Resets cooldown upon killing an enemy champion
* Gives a potential 850 unit gap between Twitch and his opponent

{{champion:107}} (Thrill of the Hunt):

* Has 725 detection range and attack range
* Activates after 2 seconds
* Gains 40% movement speed increase at all time
* Duration is 12/16/20 seconds
* 130 seconds cooldown in early ranks
* Gains vision of the nearest enemy within 2000/3000/4000 units and allows Rengar to gain a guaranteed crit if he leaps to them, but also alerts everybody within that radius you're in camouflage.
* Places him in melee range


Quite frankly Twitch has Rengar's ultimate on a basic ability, with potential 0 cd if he gets a kill. He has a shorter detection range and can attack from further away, so he is far safer than Rengar that even has to go into melee range. He doesn't alert the enemy at all, and he naturally builds critical strike so Rengar doesn't even have an advantage on that part, who has to work for it to get it on the right target while Twitch just right clicks and crits 5 people.

http://aslain.com/uploads/monthly_2017_03/tank_you_by_victorpaiam-d4h6q6d.jpg.4e5c09b6e153377124d8f2a5af2a3490.jpg

So instead of fixing a problem, you throw another problem into the mix to deal with said problem, instead of fixing both? 

Because I honestly don't get it. Rengar did not only kill ADCs, he killed Bruisers, he killed Mages. Him being able to kill a target fast to prevent "Bullshit" doesn't mean he has a rightful place in the game, nor does it excuse the level of bullshit Rengar used to have.  I'm sure you've seen the videos of just how capable Rengar was at insta-gibbing people, and you're saying that's fair because it "Deals with bullshit"?

It's ok, the point often gets lost when people focus on the champion.

The problem is (and has always been) the double standard of melee vs. ranged. Rengar and Twitch have similar roles. Twitch might not burst as fast as rengar, sure, but Twitch could always do it from a safer position. Even if Rengar did burst you, he was often actively putting himself in a dangerous position by getting into melee range. Optimally, with a squishy build. (Hence why Tank Rengar was an issue and why Rengar is being moved more towards a diver playstyle)

The issue is that if you put these two characters side-by-side and told players to pick one, they'd pick Rengar every time. Rengar is the scary monster who bursts you with zero counterplay and then runs into the jungle. Twitch is the squishy ADC who dies if you breath on him. Sure, it's not the case right this moment, but it's generally what people see when they deal with the characters. My point is that both characters are bullshit. Rengar, however, gets dealt with swiftly because he's the melee assassin who instabursts with zero counterplay.

Twitch is the subtle bullshit. The bullshit you weren't aware you stepped in. The bullshit you hate fighting against but don't say anything because you know the forums would laugh at you for complaining about someone with a 49.99% win rate. Even in this case, characters who aren't as bad as Rengar (Zed, Talon, etc.) are still shafted because this assassin-y feeling of instaburst-zero-counterplay-GG exists simply by being a class.

My core point is that both characters have flaws and need changes, but Twitch gets to scuttle out of the spotlight because "the poor ranged ADCs who are fodder to the big mean assassins" is often the prevailing discourse when it comes to assassin vs. ADC. Even if both characters can appear from stealth and crave you to pieces.

You can't really look at one ability and not look at the rest of the kit. Rengar relies on his ult for getting picks and dives. Twitch isn't really using his Q for picks and dives he's using it to reposition and catch his enemies off guard with his ult direction. Replacing Rengar ult with Twitch Q would make him pretty busted. Rengar also builds tankier since he's a diver now, a luxury Twitch doesn't have. Rengars ult also gives him the ability to pretty much guarantee a ton of extra burst, a CC removal, or a hard CC spell. 

Comparing the two without looking at their jobs and kit doesn't work. That's like comparing Thresh ult and Veigar E. Veigar E provides harder CC, is ranged so he doesn't need to get close, and is on a much lower cooldown. Thresh gives some damage but is objectively better. However when we consider Thresh is a tanky frontline support and Veigar is a squishy mage it makes more sense.

Hell, if we are going to only compare Twitch's and Rengar's camouflage then might as well do so with Twitch and Xayah's piercing attacks. Xayah gets hers at the beginning of the game and has little to no downtime, unlike Twitch who only obtains it at level 6 and has a 90 second cooldown. Without looking at their entire kits I can easily make it look that Twitch's ultimate is shit because someone else gets it for free at level 1, but anyone who has played the game knows that isn't the case.

You're making it more complicated than it actually is. Yes, let's look at Twitch's job - ADC. Now we ask, "why the fuck is Twitch popping out of stealth and assassinating anything?"

Twitch's job is ADC. The trade-off between and ADC and assassin is dps vs. burst, and assassins usually trade aoe for single-target. Twitch has no trade-offs.

Please do not spread misinformation. Camouflage was updated during the Assassin updates to universally reveal the user once within 700 units of an enemy champion. Twitch and Rengar's camouflages have the same effect radii. You must've confused Rengar's leap indicator for a camouflage indicator.

That said, I do not know why Rengar has no camouflage indicator like Evelynn or Twitch, and I agree Twitch is indeed a problem right now.

Excellent points. Love the photos that perfectly illustrate your point, too. 

As a aside, I think it's important to note here that Riot has already done away with the the roster updates that led to these sorts of situations. I think they do deserve a little credit there, generally, for understanding that those practices led to some pretty questionable design directions.

But yes, both Rengar and Twitch are in very strange places, and juxtaposing their abilities is a nice way to highlight how weird this got. Both of them need work, and threads like this are a great way to communicate to Riot that we want these champs higher on the priority list.

Oh oh! Let me juxtapose some abilities too!

I was thinking about this the other day. _Trundle Pillar versus Yorick "cage"_

Trundle Pillar pros:
•Takes longer to walk around pillar slowed, than to destroy Yorick's cage.
•Indestructable (that's a given)
•1000 range. Better than 600 range.
•Pops up _instantly_. Yorick cage must be better aimed.
•On a very easy high sustain character that can sabotage enemy tank just by pressing R.
Negs are:
•uses 5 more mana
•has a 2 second more cooldown

It's like Yorick was designed for another more fair game.

I remember long ago though people frequently said " you can't compare two different abilities in different kits!" but man times have changed and balance is so oughta whack

I mean, you do have to be careful directly comparing abilities, because not every ability is *supposed* to have the same level of power in it. 

In Twitch and Rengar's case, I feel it's especially relevant because of the *reasoning* behind Rengar's abilities being the way they are. They vision ranges and things have a logical process behind them that Twitch's abilities don't adhere to, and he *also* has the advantage of being ranged. That feels bad.

I'll simplify this for people to understand. 

An ADC should never be able to 1v1 an assassin or be able to out burst them unless they are extremely ahead. 

That is what assassins are made to do. Just like tanks should be able to beat up on an assassin because of their tankiness _(EDIT: Bruisers more than tanks but you get the idea)_. If you want balance then champion roles are going to have to be simplified to do what they were meant to do. 

ADC - Sustained damage 
Assassin - Burst squishies
Tank - Tank damage
Support - Provide support by way of CC, Healing, Buffs, etc.

lets not forget that rengars is also an ultimate while twitchs is a basic ability that resets
